dialogues.text: Hills. Trees. Blue sky and green grass. A nice place to b buried. WIDE ON a respectable turnout, assembled for just such an occasion. Several dozen mourners gather before an open gr the steel casket poised and waiting above the void. THE REVEREND (60's, about what you’d expect) intones the traditional platitudes. As the sound of his voice rises a falls, we hear only snippets.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: ..-Richard Stoker was, first and foremost, a family man. A devoted husband to his wife Evelyn, a loving father to his daughter India... Evie and India are seated by themselves at the front. Even in repose Evie is a standout, a lily among the reeds black sunglasses shielding her eyes from the sun's bright glare. India sits next to her, hands in her lap, black and white saddle shoes crossed demurely at the ankle. Obtained by Wentworth Miller 101 http://www.wentworthmiller101.net

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of them is in tears.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++-A pillar of our small community, Richard was a model to the town of Middle Bend... At the back stand townsfolk from the aforementioned town. Acquaintances mostly. People who had business with Richar Stoker or knew him socially. People who came to show thei respects or to satisfy curiosity. People who had nothing better to do.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...What it means to be a man, to walk through this world with openness, honesty, integrity... A breeze ruffles India’s hair. She turns her face to the closes her eyes. When she opens them, she sees something didn’t expect: a man, alone on the hillside above the fun party. He’s standing quite still, hands shoved deep in hi pockets. REVEREND (CONT’D) .+-+Richard Stoker was taken from us by a cruel twist of fate, for reasons unknown and unknowable... India squints into the sun, trying to get a better look. from this distance the man’s features are a blur, indisti Someone coughs behind her, loudly. India turns to look. When she turns back, the man is gone, REVEREND (CONT’D) ++-Let us bow our heads... India bows her head with the rest, but her eyes remain fi on the empty hillside.
